Nacogdoches ISD trustees voted unanimously to push back the start date of classes to Sept. 8. The decision arrived at during a special meeting held Tuesday will provide the district more time to receive deliveries of new laptops for use by teachers. NISD is also awaiting delivery of more PPE (personal protective equipment used to combat the spread of COVID-19) before classes begin.

The calendar agreed on by the board eliminates some professional development days for staff during the academic year, allowing NISD to keep May 28, 2021, the last day of classes for students.

The newly adjusted calendar adopted by the board also closes the district on Thursday and Friday, Aug. 27-28, because of the threat of Hurricane Laura, which is forecast to begin impacting the region Wednesday evening.

The cement began flowing before 4 a.m. this morning at the building site of the new Emeline Carpenter Elementary School where crews were pouring another phase of the campus foundation.

Twenty trucks were expected for the pour, which began well before sun up. Ralph LaRue, NISD Director of Facilities and Construction, was on hand and said later in the day everything had gone well at the site.

Work began earlier this year on the new campus. Crews have moved tons of dirt at the site, installing new drainage and creating a long driveway from East Main Street that will be used for parent access to the campus, once complete.

The building site is located on SE Stallings Drive, across from NISD's McMichael Middle School.

Board members sworn into office included James Montoya, the incumbent District III trustee; Farshid Niroumand, incumbent at-large trustee; and Leabeth Abt, the newly elected trustee representing District II. Abt was unopposed on the ballot and replaced G.W. Neal, who chose not to seek re-election.

Trustees also re-organized the board during Thursday‚Äôs meeting. The board unanimously voted Pam Fitch as president, James Montoya as vice president and Mindy Winslow as secretary.

The project, funded by the 2018 NISD bond package, will greatly enlarge garage facilities where NISD staff perform repairs and routine maintenance on buses. Previously, four buses could fit in the garage but the large doors had to remain open. The project is also renovating and expanding office and meeting space and creating new covered fuel and bus wash stations.

post_text: At 7 p.m. tonight in the Nacogdoches High School Auditorium, "Stepping Through the Decades: A Musical Tribute" will take place. This is a free event sponsored by the Students of Color organization at Nacogdoches High School. The Students of Color host this annual event to celebrate Black History Month. One of the sponsors, NISD Police Chief Sandra Murray, will be hosting the event alongside student President Khadeja Williams. Those attending can expect to see a variety of performance art including spoken word, dance, singing, poetry and drama. NISD faculty member Terrance Hicks is a reverend of the Power of the Word Ministry that will be performing a skit at the event. Mostly high school students will be performing, but there will be a couple performances by elementary school students. The performances will step audience members from the 1960s through the 2000s.

The Nacogdoches Dragons will host the Lufkin Panthers Friday, Jan. 3, for boys and girls basketball games at Nacogdoches High School. Fans from Lufkin will park in the bus loop located along NE Stallings Drive in front of the main school entrance or in faculty parking lots located on the same side of the school as Appleby Sand Road. Those fans will enter the NHS gym from the bus loop entry into the 9th-grade building. Home fans will park in the student parking lot located on the same side as the fire station and enter the 9th-grade building from the student parking lot.

Once fans are in the building and purchase a ticket, they will need to enter the gym entrance on the same side they entered the building, walk up the stairs and sit on the designated HOME and VISITOR sides. Visitors will sit on the North/East side of the gym, and Home fans will sit in the South/West side of the gym. Guests will not be able to cross the basketball court to get to their seats. Security will be present to direct guests to the correct side of the gym.
